stories.title: Five ways to reduce variance in A/B testing
NFT sales ‘have declined 92% since their peak’

stories.text:
For the past couple years I've been trying to learn Android app development. I've been working as a 'software engineer' off and on for 10 years simply out of corporate need (didn't go to school for). I had an idea for a personal note taking app and now I'm considering the possibility of releasing it. In my search for testers, Hacker News came up many times and I thought this may be a good place to post and request some testing and evaluation. As the site rules indicate, I'm looking for honest, respectful, helpful input.

ABOUT THE APP

The app is called ResearchDB, a "documenting" form of note taking app - meaning it requires you to "document" your source and has a 1/2 dozen required fields. In other words, the purpose of this note taking app is not just noting something of interest, but "supportively documenting" the note and source. This is why I call it ResearchDB. We all have particular, beliefs, ideas, interests, and this note taking app is intended to be a way to document those beliefs, interests and ideas through the creation of multiple "subject-based" databases containing notes in a way that helps us remember and recall those things in a way that helps us remember them. And since it is a phone app, we can recall and pull up those supportive notes at any moment with our handy smartphone.

THE APK TARGET COMPATABITY

The Minimum SDK is 28 and the target is 30 It requires Internet and Storage (read/write) permissions so that you have the ability to document sources and can export or import notes and databases on topics of interests.

ABOUT THE LINKS

I have included a link to the Android APK for downloading and a YouTube link which demonstrates the intent and how to use the app in 9-10 minutes. The APK link takes you to "ufile.io" - a web storage source I use, but it is free to download, there is not a requirement to sign up, create an account or purchase, simply just choose the slower - free download option. The APK should be signed and I will assume a tester may know how to sideload it through developer options to their Android phone.

APK https://ufile.io/kw5gonpc

YouTube https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OvpgviLECXA

BTW, the app also includes a PDF pictorial guide on how to do everything - besides the YouTube video.

I wasn't sure whether or not I should include one of these links above and which would be a more appropriate choice if so. Since it says "OR" between the URL field and posting field here, I didn't read that I couldn't add them here, but let me know whether I posted these links incorrectly.

Thanks for this opportunity and being willing to test and try this if you do.

- Scott
